intro: Amsinckia andersonii, commonly known as the Anderson's fiddleneck, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and woolly, hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators. Amsinckia andersonii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
